Zelensky says Ukrainian army has retaken Kupiansk
subhead: President Volodymyr Zelensky filmed himself near the front line to show that his army was capable of mounting a counteroffensive. Ukraine retaking control of the city of Kupiansk would represent its only successful counteroffensive in 2025.

title: Why the EU decided to freeze Russian sovereign assets in Europe until the Ukraine war ends
subhead: To circumvent a potential veto from Viktor Orban's Hungary, member states invoked an article of the Treaty on the Functioning of the EU, which covers economic stability in times of crisis.

title: Thailand says four soldiers killed in Cambodia conflict, denies Trump truce claim
subhead: At least 24 people have been killed in the conflict this week, including four Thai soldiers the defense ministry said died in the border area on Saturday. Cambodia suspended all of its border crossings with Thailand on Saturday.

title: How French spies, police and military personnel are betrayed by advertising data
subhead: Using easily accessible advertising data, Le Monde was able to pinpoint the identities, home addresses and daily routines of several dozen people working for sensitive official entities.

Paris Agreement: Ten years later, key players look back on 'incredible alignment of stars'
subhead: Le Monde takes a look back at the the signing of the Paris Agreement in the French capital on December 12, 2015, a major geopolitical agreement reached after two weeks of intense negotiations that aimed to limit global warming to 'well below' 2°C and at 'pursuing efforts' to keep the temperature increase to 1.5°C.

title: The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
subhead: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.

title: Ukraine ready to consider Donbas demilitarized zone in concession to end war
subhead: Mykhailo Podolyak, an advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, tells Le Monde that the zone would require Ukrainian and Russian forces to both pull back from the front line.
